refnamediv.refpurpose: variance Return the variance for an attribute.
refnamediv.para:
deprecated
var Deprecated. The var operator may be removed in the future. Use the var aggregate instead.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The var operator returns the variance of a set of values taken from an array attribute.

refsect1.title: Inputs
refsect1.para:
The var operator takes the following arguments:
array: a source array with one or more attributes and one or more dimensions.
attribute: Optional attribute. If no attribute is provided, the first attribute in the source array is used.
dimension_n: An optional list of dimensions to group by.

informalexample.para: This example finds the variance of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para:
Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0];

Store values of random values between 0 and 9 in m3x3:
AFL% store(build(m3x3,random()%10),m3x3); [ [(5),(2),(3)], [(1),(9),(1)], [(1),(9),(1)] ]

Select the variance of each row of m3x3:
AFL% var(m3x3,val,i); [(2.33333),(21.3333),(21.3333)]
